1.text: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.

3.text: Let the day perish wherein I was born, And the night which said, There is a man-child conceived.

4.text: Let that day be darkness; Let not God from above seek for it, Neither let the light shine upon it.

5.text: Let darkness and the shadow of death claim it for their own; Let a cloud dwell upon it; Let all that maketh black the day terrify it.

6.text: As for that night, let thick darkness seize upon it: Let it not rejoice among the days of the year; Let it not come into the number of the months.

7.text: Lo, let that night be barren; Let no joyful voice come therein.

8.text: Let them curse it that curse the day, Who are ready to rouse up leviathan.

9.text: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark: Let it look for light, but have none; Neither let it behold the eyelids of the morning:

10.text: Because it shut not up the doors of my motherâ€™s womb, Nor hid trouble from mine eyes.

11.text: Why died I not from the womb? Why did I not give up the ghost when my mother bare me?

12.text: Why did the knees receive me? Or why the breast, that I should suck?

13.text: For now should I have lain down and been quiet; I should have slept; then had I been at rest,

14.text: With kings and counsellors of the earth, Who built up waste places for themselves;

15.text: Or with princes that had gold, Who filled their houses with silver

16.text: Or as a hidden untimely birth I had not been, As infants that never saw light.

17.text: There the wicked cease from troubling; And there the weary are at rest.

18.text: There the prisoners are at ease together; They hear not the voice of the taskmaster.

19.text: The small and the great are there: And the servant is free from his master.

20.text: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, And life unto the bitter in soul;

21.text: Who long for death, but it cometh not, And dig for it more than for hid treasures;

22.text: Who rejoice exceedingly, And are glad, when they can find the grave?

23.text: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, And whom God hath hedged in?

24.text: For my sighing cometh before I eat, And my groanings are poured out like water.

25.text: For the thing which I fear cometh upon me, And that which I am afraid of cometh unto me.

26.text: I am not at ease, neither am I quiet, neither have I rest; But trouble cometh.
